DOC.brief_title: Risk Assessment Febrile Neutropenia Grade 3-4 Neutropenia Patients With Non-hematological Cancer Treated With Conventional Chemotherapy
DOC.criteria: Male female > 18 year Histologically confirm solid tumor . Subjects receive chemotherapy / radiotherapy last 3 month . Subject initiate chemotherapy ( ie , cycle 1 , day 1 ) The chemotherapy regimen inherent risk febrile neutropenia 1020 % . Planning minimum 3 cycle chemotherapy . Adequate bone marrow reserve define : leukocyte ≥ 3,000 / mm3 , platelet ≥ 100.000/mm3 ; neutrophil ≥ 1,500 / mm3 . Adequate hepatic renal function , define : bilirubin < 1.5 time normal value , ALT AST < 3 time normal range ( elevate 5 time normal value patient know liver metastasis ) ; creatinine < 1.5 time upper normal value ECOG ≤ 2 . Informed consent Patients treatment investigational treatment . Active infection last 72 h start chemotherapy . Indication chemotherapy dose intensity chemotherapy include risk rating febrile neutropenia < 10 % > 20 % . Patients concomitant chemoradiotherapy . Patients treat biological drug monotherapy . Any condition cause neutropenia . History bone marrow transplant stem cell .
